content: Stai usando il protocollo POP3 o IMAP? Nel primo cosa le eventuali sottocartelle non possono essere scaricate. Nel secondo caso potrebbe essere necessario sottoscrivere le sottocartelle per la sincronizzazione -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/sincronizzazione-imap#w_configurazione-della-sincronizzazione-ed-utilizzo-dello-spazio-sul-disco
creator: @next

content:
Gentile Next, purtroppo avevo importato con POP3. Ora cosa mi consigli di fare? Cancello tutto da Thunderbird e ripeto con IMAP sottoscrivendo le sottocartelle per la sincronizzazione?

Grazie mille, D.
creator: ddanglari

content:
Ti suggerirei di procedere così:

  • In Thunderbird indivia una cartella chiamata Cartelle locali
  • Crea una o più sottocartelle sotto Cartelle locali
  • Copia o sposta tutte le email già ricevute tramite POP3 in queste cartelle
  • Verifica che ci siano tutti i messaggi
  • Solo a questo punto elimina l'account POP3 da menu > impostazioni account > Azioni account
  • Riavvia Thunderbird e ricrea l'account come IMAP

Questa cautela è necessaria perché nella configurazione standard la posta scaricata con POP3 viene eliminata dal server e quindi l'unica copia disponibile è quella in Thunderbird.

Per riportare una copia della posta anche sul server, ti basta a questo punto copiare i messaggi da Cartelle locali alla cartella Posta in arrivo del account IMAP.

Esiste anche una procedura di conversione dell'account da POP a IMAP descritta qui https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/passare-da-account-pop-a-imap che è simile a quello che ho scritto sopra e che ti consiglio di leggere e valutare se si adatta meglio al tuo caso
creator: @next

content:
In Thunderbird, on the Tools menu, click Account Settings. In the navigation pane of Account Settings, select Copies & Folders for your email account. In the details pane, under When sending messages, automatically, select Other. In the drop-down list, select your user name, select Sent Items, and then click OK

Regards, Will
creator: willjoe24421

content: Verizon and AOL require an APP password when using email clients on a PC. I believe you must go to the AOL site and select the security page and can set up the APP password there. See this page for more info: https://help.aol.com/articles/Create-and-manage-app-password
creator: davidsk

content:
I have fixed this. I'm not sure which step fixed this.

First I updated Thunderbird to the newest version. Next I followed these instructions: 1. Set thunderbird in safe mode https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/safe-mode-thunderbird 2.Find and open config editor in TB (equivalent of FF about:config) https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/config-editor 3. Add the correspond boolean value in config editor and set it to true general.useragent.compatMode.firefox click ok 4. Restart your tb client 5. Once again credential window will be present to you login as usual. 6.Everything will work fine from now on. 7.Turn off safe mode and restart TB

It still didn't work however, so I deleted the account entirely, then tried to re-add it with IMAP, where it failed saying something about the credentials being incorrect.

So I looked at the settings and changed the authentication method to OAuth2. After I did this I got a pop up window from Microsoft asking to enter my password, then I got a MFA notification to authenticate. Then I had to press allow the app. Then it worked.

Looks like something relating to Microsoft's MFA not playing well with Thunderbird (this worked immediately with my Gmail account.)
creator: alexandersugden

content: I changed the authentication to OAuth2 for a hotmail.com account, and it worked for the incoming IMAP, but not for the outgoing SMTP. Reverting the outgoing to 'normal password' restored sending. Unexpected, since OAuth2 works for both incoming and outgoing for other services such as gmail, AOL, Yahoo.

content:
Thank you. Retention settings still exist at the folder level even with a POP account. Is there no master setting that is comparable to the Accounting settings using IMAP?

My problem is this: New folders normally default to "Use my account settings" with the "Don't delete any messages" and "Always keep starred messages" options checked. However, somewhere along the way some of the folders have been modified (perhaps by a faulty update) to have "Delete messages more that 1100" checked. The modification is random. I have several hundred mail folders and it would be helpful if I could re-establish the default setting in one place.
creator: msi1432

content:
For POP accounts, the retention policy is defined in Account Settings, Disk Space, for each account. To reset the retention policy for folders, close TB and delete the .msf files in the profile folder, i.e. delete the .msf files in Mail/<popservername> and all sbd subfolders. This can probably be done with a single command, e.g.

del /s /q/ *.msf after opening a command prompt in

C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\<profilename>\Mail

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Message_aging
creator: sfhowes

creator: mdm54

content:
Mary, Here are the steps: - start Thunderbird with your new profile that has no addresses, the one where you want the addresses to be - click tools>import>import from a file>import addressbook>SQLITE database - in next window, navigate to the desired abook.sqlite file and click OK. - Thunderbird will prompt on whether you want the addresses to be added to Personal Addresses (the default) or to Collected Addresses. Click your preference and press Enter key - The addresses will then be imported into your profile.

For the future, I encourage you to do tools>export periodically so that you will have a backup in case of future problems.
creator: davidsk
